Description: Fragment of large conical foot of Chian pottery chalice, or fragment of neck of East Greek (Chian?) oenochoe; white slip; exterior: glazed streaky black; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), temenos (said to be)
Curator's comments: If from a chalice, the size of the sherd and the lack of diagnostic elements makes it difficult to determine to what style the sherd belongs; the width and curvature suggest a large chalice, perhaps from a chalice in the Mature Animal Style or Grand Style. Yet the text cut upside-down would be unique in the corpus, even if two-line inscriptions do appear on chalice feet.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 718, no. 762)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0646) (phase 2)
